meanings.definition: To send or deliver in advance.
meanings.sent1: She preships the packages to ensure they arrive on time.
meanings.sent2: The company always preships orders to avoid delays.
meanings.sent3: He preships the gifts so they reach their destination before the event.
meanings.sent4: The idea of preshipping the goods seemed like a smart move.
meanings.sent5: Preshipping the items guarantees timely delivery.

meanings.definition: To prepare or arrange for shipment.
meanings.sent1: They preships the products to get them ready for delivery.
meanings.sent2: Before shipping, it is important to preships the items properly.
meanings.sent3: The team preships the goods with great care to avoid any mistakes.
meanings.sent4: She preships the packages as if each one is a precious gift.
meanings.sent5: Properly preshipping the items ensures safe transportation.

meanings.definition: The act of sending or delivering in advance.
meanings.sent1: The preships of the documents helped expedite the process.
meanings.sent2: Receiving preships of the supplies made the project run smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected preships of the goods caught everyone by surprise.
meanings.sent4: The preships of the equipment saved them valuable time.
meanings.sent5: The early preships of the materials were greatly appreciated.
